channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: India’s Ambassador Is Person of Interest in a Canadian Investigation, India Says
item.description: The move by the Indian government comes as the two countries have been locked in a dispute following the assassination of a Sikh separatist in Canada ...

item.title: Climate Disasters Are Shattering the Lives of People Who Live in Mobile Homes
item.description: Millions of Americans, many poor and vulnerable, live in mobile and manufactured homes. When catastrophe strikes, they’re often on their own.

item.title: Egg Freezing Isn’t a Choice For Most Latinas. But It Was For Me.
item.description: As a Latina, I was taught that my purpose was to produce. But I needed a break.

item.title: Meteorologists Face Harassment and Death Threats Amid Hurricane Disinformation
item.description: Weather experts say the spiraling falsehoods, especially claims that the government is creating or controlling storms, have gotten out of hand.

item.title: Lilly Ledbetter, Whose Fight for Equal Pay Changed U.S. Law, Dies at 86
item.description: Her lawsuit against Goodyear helped pave the way for the 2009 Fair Pay Act, which was signed into law by former President Barack Obama.

item.title: The Broadsheet is now Most Powerful Women Daily
item.description: The newsletter you know and love is getting a new name—with the same commitment to the stories that matter to women.

item.title: Israel Attacks Tent Camp at Gaza Hospital
item.description: People worked through smoke and darkness to extinguish fires and look through debris following the deadly attack on Deir al-Balah.

item.title: Your corporate board might be the weakest link when it comes to adopting AI
item.description: Many say that AI isn’t even on the table of their boards, and it could cost them in the long run.

item.title: India’s Ambassador Is Person of Interest in a Canadian Investigation, India Says
item.description: The move by the Indian government comes as the two countries have been locked in a dispute following the assassination of a Sikh separatist in Canada ...

item.title: How Palestinians Are Roadblocked in the West Bank
item.description: Driving in the Israeli-occupied West Bank is an incredibly different experience depending on who you are. Ben Hubbard, international correspondent for...

item.title: A French Immersion Program in Provence Leads to a Good Life Lesson
item.description: After a painful breakup, the author travels to Provence for a language immersion homestay and learns the value of facing up to mistakes.

item.title: Live Updates: Deadly Israeli Strike Hits Central Gaza Hospital Complex
item.description: Israel said it targeted Hamas fighters inside the hospital compound, where displaced people were living in tents. A separate strike killed several peo...

item.title: AI could be the drunk uncle in health care—or fix our broken systems
item.description: 'While the benefits of automating burdensome tasks are clear, it’s important to tread carefully,' writes Corti co-founder and CTO Lars Maaløe.

item.title: Nike’s new CEO starts today: Here’s what experts say Elliott Hill should focus on
item.description: Barclays and Goldman Sachs have identified the key issues facing Nike's new CEO Elliott Hill.

item.title: Meet 9 CFOs from the Fortune 500 ready to make the jump to CEO
item.description: A seasoned executive recruiting expert identifies potential chief executives.
